Calculates variables necessary for WATS Plots

Source: R/AugmentData.R
AugmentCycleData.Rd

Calculates variables necessary for WATS Plots. This the first of two functions that needs to be called to produce WATS Plots. AnnotateData() is the second.

Usage

AugmentYearDataWithMonthResolution( dsLinear, dateName )
AugmentYearDataWithSecondResolution( dsLinear, dateName )

Arguments

dsLinear

The data.frame to containing the detailed data.

dateName

The variable name in dsLinear containing the date or datetime value.

Value

Returns a data.frame with additional variables: CycleTally, ProportionThroughCycle, ProportionID, and TerminalPointInCycle.

Examples

library(Wats)
dsLinear <- CountyMonthBirthRate2005Version
dsLinear <- dsLinear[dsLinear$CountyName=="oklahoma", ]
dsLinear <- AugmentYearDataWithMonthResolution(dsLinear=dsLinear, dateName="Date")
head(dsLinear)
